pages.title: ⎧ Seven of Wands ⎧
pages.text: Spirit of Valour$(br)      ♂ Mars in ♌ Leo

A young person on a rugged cliff brandishing a staff; six other staves are raised towards them from below.$(br)  It is a card of valour, for, on the surface, six are attacking one, who has, however, the vantage position.$(br)  On the intellectual plane, it signifies discussion, wordy strife; in business - negotiations, war of trade, barter, competition.$(br)  It can mean success, or escaping to safety, for the combatant is on the top and

his enemies may be unable to reach him.$(br)  We can think of this card as showing a deeper level of self-understanding beginning to emerge after a burst of activity.$(br)  Again, instead of confidence, we see a tentative testing of purpose and identity.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Uncertainty, slow development of awareness, quietness.$(br)  Thinking about issues. A new purpose beginning to emerge.
$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  A call for more confidence, greater self-awareness, communication.$(br)  It is also a caution against indecision.
